[lgc_column grid="33" tablet_grid="33" mobile_grid="100" last="false"]Sign Up [/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="33" tablet_grid="33" mobile_grid="100" last="false"][/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="33" tablet_grid="33" mobile_grid="100" last="True"][/lgc_column]   [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="false"] [/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="true"]

[tabby title="Events"]

Tabby ipsum dolor sit amet, kitty sunbathe dolor, feed me. [tabby title="Info for Artists"] Lay down in your way catnip stuck in a tree, sunbathe kittens. [tabby title="Info for NPO's"] sleep in the sink climb the curtains attack, give me fish. [tabbyending] [/lgc_column]   [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="false"]

Mission Statement

Texas Accountants and Lawyers for the Arts (TALA) provides Texas artists and arts organizations with legal and accounting assistance to enable them to maximize their potential, shape our cultural landscape, and contribute to the creative economy. TALA provides individualized volunteer legal and accounting services to financially qualified artists and arts nonprofits, hosts educational seminars and clinics, and produces educational materials to increase business knowledge in the arts. TALA was formed in 1979 to meet the legal and accounting needs of artists and arts nonprofits. Our services include lawyer and accountant pro bono assistance, dispute resolution services, and educational programs for the artistic and business community. Programs are designed to help artists apply legal and accounting concepts for their benefit. Your membership dollars provide for TALA's small staff, office facilities, and the insurance coverage necessary to coordinate and support TALA volunteers. TALA does not represent individuals or organizations before courts, arbitration panels, administrative proceedings, or other governmental bodies. TALA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. [/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="true"]

Tax Help

TALA does not offer Individual 1040 and Non-Profit 990 Tax Filing Services. Those needing assistance filing a 1040 should contact one of the following tax service organizations, just click on the city name below to get more info: Amarillo Austin Beaumont Corpus Christi Dallas El Paso Houston Lubbock Midland Odessa San Antonio The IRS offers free in-person federal tax filing too, but with restrictions. You must have an adjusted gross income below $51,000 to qualify. The tax preparation help is usually provided in IRS offices, libraries and colleges around the country. You can find a location at this link. IT IS YOUR RESPONSIBILITY TO CONFIRM YOUR ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE SERVICES BEFOREHAND. EACH OF THESE SERVICES RESERVES THE RIGHT TO REFUSE SERVICE TO ANYONE FOR ANY REASON [/lgc_column] Texas Accountants and Lawyers for the Arts proudly acknowledges the following patronsfor their generous sponsorship of the programs and clinics that support our mission to serve the Texas creative economy. [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="false"] [/lgc_column][lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="false"] [/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="false"]

[/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="false"]

item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: bobbyjoseph
item.content:encoded: [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="false"]Texas Accountants and Lawyers for the Arts (TALA) was formed in 1979 to help meet the legal and accounting needs of artists and arts nonprofits across the State of Texas. TALA volunteers throughout the state handle more than 350 matters per year. This amounts to more than six hundred thousand dollars annually in donated services to the arts and cultural community. TALAs pro bono legal and accounting services are offered to artists from all creative disciplines, including visual artists, musicians, actors, dancers, film makers and writers. Over 600 attorneys and accountants volunteer their time each year, assisting in legal and accounting matters that might otherwise remain unresolved and unrepresented. TALAs services include legal and accounting assistance, nonprofit incorporation, dispute resolution services, and educational programs and publications for artists and arts nonprofits to help apply legal and accounting concepts for their benefit. Membership and Donor dollars provide for TALA's small staff, office facilities and the insurance coverage necessary to coordinate and support TALA volunteers. Board of Directors Executive Committee Elizabeth Rogers, President (Greenberg Traurig, LLP) Brooks Rice, Vice President of External Affairs (Brooks Rice Law) Jamie Schue, Secretary President-Elect (ERCOT) Board Members Jamie Baker (Thompson Coe) Megan Dagerman (Norton Rose Fulbright) Rahul D. Engineer (Intel) Peter Helf (Austin Chamber Music Center) Erik Metzger (Intel) Andrea Perez Affleck (Kessler Collins PC) Lisa Sretenovic (The Mangold Group Certified Public Accountants, PC)[/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="true"] Become a member "We want to thank TALA for all the time your staff put into making Texans for the Arts a success. TALA truly makes a difference, and it is a pleasure to work with you." - Nancy Loving, President, Texans for the Arts "The Service... you offer... is invaluable and deserves more testimony statewide. I have learned a lot and felt secure that you are behind us." - Carol Short, Coordinator, Denton Art & Jazz Festival "Thank you on behalf of all the artists involved in the conflict concerning the show... Your consultations, along with the expert TALA mediator proved successful." - Wayne Gilbert, Visual Artist, Houston, TX DONATE network for good Donate to TALA by shopping at Kroger or Randall's Use the Kroger Share Card or Randall's Remarkable Card and each grocer will donate a percentage of your total purchases to TALA. When shopping at Randall's, mention TALA #6992 when asked for your Remarkable card prior to checkout. Before checkout at Kroger, simply present your TALA share card (available at TALA). Take a copy of the Customer Letter to your local Kroger Store and link your Plus Card today![/lgc_column]

item.title: Services
item.dc:creator: herinnisha
item.content:encoded:
Services We Offer

Lawyer and Accountant Referral

Legal Services for Artists and Arts Nonprofits

Accounting Services for Artists and Arts Nonprofits

centraltexas@talarts.org

Referrals

TALA matches low-income artists and small budget arts non-profits with volunteer attorneys and accountants to assist with arts-related legal and financial matters.


Legal Services

Non-Profit Arts Organization Incorporation

Contract Drafting, Negotiation and Review

Estate Planning for Artists

Copyright & Trademark

IP Licensing

Arts-Related Landlord/Tenant Issues

Demand Letters

Dispute Resolution / Arts Mediation

Accounting Services

Financial Reviews

Chart of Accounts

Financial Statements

Annual Budgets

Application for tax exempt status

Employment Taxes

Please be advised that TALA is not staffed to provide emergency legal or accounting assistance, nor does TALA provide representation to individuals or organizations before courts, arbitration panels, administrative proceedings, or other governmental bodies.

We don't offer

Family Law (Child Custody, Divorce, etc)

1040 Individual Tax Return

Personal Injury

Criminal Law

Litigation

Audits

To be matched with a volunteer through TALA, you must be:

  • A resident of the state of Texas or organization established in the state of Texas, AND
  • An individual artist with a combined annual household income less than $50,000 OR an arts nonprofit organization with annual gross revenue less than $200,000 AND less than $500,000 in assets.

If you meet the qualifications above, you are eligible to be matched with a volunteer.

First, become a member of TALA.

Then, fill out a Request for Assistance Form:

All Individual Artist Members please use the Individual Request for Assistance.

All NonProfit Organizations please use the  Organization Request for Assistance.

All individuals and organizations requesting assistance must current members of TALA.Renew or join TALA as a member.

  • A resident of the state of Texas or organization established in the state of Texas, AND
  • An individual artist with a combined annual household income less than $50,000 OR an arts nonprofit organization with annual gross revenue less than $200,000 AND less than $500,000 in assets.

Then, fill out a Request for Assistance Form:

All Individual Artist Members please use the Individual Request for Assistance.

All NonProfit Organizations please use the Organization Request for Assistance.

All individuals and organizations requesting assistance must current members of TALA.Renew or join TALA as a member.

item.title: Members
item.dc:creator: herinnisha
item.content:encoded:
Ready to become a member of TALA?

Individual Artists


Are you an individual artist making less than $50,000 a year combined gross income?

 

The annual membership fee for Individual Artists is $75, which entitles you to receive services from TALA for an entire year.

Application Forms for Individual Artists


New Member

If you have never had a TALA membership, or if your membership with TALA lapsed over 18 months ago, please use the New Individual Artist Application

Renewing Member

You will need to know your Individual Artist Member ID Number in order to renew.

Please use the Renewing Member Application.

 

Arts Non Profit Organization


Are you an arts nonprofit with annual gross revenue less than $200,000 and less than $500,000 in total assets?

The annual membership fee for Nonprofit Organizations is $250, which entitles you to receive services from TALA for an entire year.

Application Forms for Non Profit Organization Members


New Member

If you have never had a TALA nonprofit organization membership, or if that membership with TALA lapsed over 18 months ago, please use the NEW Nonprofit Membership Application

Renewing Member

You will need to know your Non Profit Membership ID Number in order to renew.

Please use the Renewing Nonprofit Member Application.

Current Members

Do you need to make a request for assistance? Use one of these forms to let us know about your issue. 

  • Individual Request for Assistance Form
  • NonProfit Organization Request for Assistance Form

If you are having issues with our new membership system online, please email attorney@talarts.org for assistance. If you are emailing on a holiday or a weekend, please understand we may be checking emails M-F only, on non-holidays, during regular business hours. Please be patient and we will help you.

item.title: Events
item.dc:creator: herinnisha
item.content:encoded:
Upcoming Events




Estate Planning for Artists

[lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="false"]
When October
Where TBA
Member Fees Free
Non Member Fees $75
[/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="50" tablet_grid="50" mobile_grid="100" last="true"] [/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="100" tablet_grid="100" mobile_grid="100" last="true"] Event Description October is Estate Planning Month If you're a TALA member, don't forget that your membership benefits include estate planning services. TALA members can be matched with an attorney to formalize arrangements by filling out the online Request for Assistance form. Learn about protecting yourself, your family, and your legacy with these essential estate planning documents: Last Will and Testament with a Contingent Trust Texas Durable Power of Attorney Texas Medical Power of Attorney Texas Directive to Physicians (Living Will) Appointment of Guardian for Minor or Special Needs Children Declaration of Guardian in the Event of Later Incapacity or Need of Guardian HIPAA Release Appointment of Agent to Control Disposition of Remains If you're not a TALA member and wish to be referred to an estate planning attorney, financially qualified artists may join TALA for $75 to receive services. Your annual TALA membership allows you to request attorney services for matters related to creating and sustaining a career in the arts for one full calendar year. [/lgc_column]

Past Events

[lgc_column grid="100" tablet_grid="100" mobile_grid="100" last="true"]

TALA Dallas Week, Oct 13-15, 2015

Estate Planning for Austin Artists, Oct 7, 2015

The Austin Chapter of the Texas Society of CPAs Presents: Nonprofit Financial Class

Presentation for Austin Musicians:: Get Your Money: Registering for SoundExchange, Collecting Performance Royalties, and Union IP Funds

TALA & Fresh Arts Present: Free Legal Clinic For Houston Artists

[/lgc_column]

item.title: Volunteers
item.dc:creator: herinnisha
item.content:encoded:
Volunteer Your Time

TALA is seeking licensed legal and accounting professionals as well as individuals who would like to consider volunteering their time and expertise in the following areas:  
  • Legal Services (Must be a Texas licensed attorney)
  • Accounting Services (Must be a Texas-licensed CPA)
  • Legal or Accounting Speaker for TALA seminars and workshops
  • Legal or Accounting Writer for TALA publications
  • Dispute Resolution/Mediation
  • Graphic Design Services
  • Computer Services
  • Marketing
  • Office Assistance

If you are interested in volunteering:

  • Please fill out and submit our online Volunteer Interest Questionnaire
  • Current law and undergraduate students must apply to volunteer with TALA through our internship program
  • Read "Becoming A Volunteer" to learn what is expected of TALA pro bono volunteers
  • If you have other questions, please contact the TALA office onNUMBER

item.title: Publications
item.dc:creator: herinnisha
item.content:encoded: [lgc_column grid="100" tablet_grid="100" mobile_grid="100" last="false"]Disclosure Rules for Charitable Organizations For organizations seeking information concerning the rules surrounding charitable contributions, Blazek & Vetterling has provided a comprehensive summary illustrating, among other things, how charitable contributions are recognized for tax purposes and how to assign fair market value to items offered for auction or as part of a gala fundraiser. A special thanks to CPA and TALA Board Member, Jody Blazek. (Published 2011)[/lgc_column] [lgc_column grid="100" tablet_grid="100" mobile_grid="100" last="false"]Personal Services Filing and Documentation Requirements Developed by Blazek & Vetterling, this document was created to aid organizations in distinguishing between an employee and a contractor. Also includes a sample Contractor Engagement Letter. A special thanks to CPA and TALA Board Member, Jody Blazek. (Published 2011)[/lgc_column]

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.dc:creator: herinnisha
item.content:encoded:
Frequently Asked Questions

How can I get assistance from TALA ?

In order to receive assistance from TALA you must be a member. Once you are a member, we will look at the circumstances of your case and determine whether it can be handled by one of TALA's staff attorneys or pro bono volunteers. If we cannot assist you, we will do our best to refer you to an attorney who may be able to help.

Are there any reasons TALA may not be able to assist me?

While TALA does its best to help as many clients as possible, TALA reserves the right to reject a client's application for assistance under certain circumstances, including, but not limited to: Matters requiring litigation. TALA does not handle litigation. TALA does, however, provide mediation services, which is a possible alternative to litigation. Complex matters potentially requiring too much time to be resolved on a volunteer basis. Unavailability of a qualified volunteer to handle a particular request. You may not meet our income guidelines. Please also note that TALA cannot accept cases that require immediate assistance. If you need immediate assistance, we'll do our best to find you an appropriate referral agency.

What kind of cases does TALA handle?

TALA assists with legal issues pertaining to individual artists: contracts, copyright, licensing agreements, art-related insurance, landlord/tenant issues (pertaining to studio space). TALA does not assist business entities such as record labels or production companies. TALA also assists with legal issues for arts nonprofits: board issues, contracts, leasing agreements, etc. TALA does not handle: tax returns, family law, criminal law, business associations, bankruptcy, or litigation.

Where can I look for help if my issue is not something handled by TALA?

For general legal assistance throughout Texas: www.texaslawhelp.org For nonprofit organizations in Texas: http://www.tano.org/ For a referral for an attorney for hire, contact the State Bar of Texas Lawyer Referral Service, or for Austin and Central Texas, contact the Lawyer Referral Service of Central Texas. For a referral for a CPA for hire, contact the Texas Society for CPAs. If you arent sure if TALA handles your type of case, just drop us a line at info@talarts.org. Well do our best to help!

item.title: Do I Qualify?
item.dc:creator: herinnisha
item.content:encoded:
Do I Qualify?

Eligibility Criteria

To be matched with a volunteer through TALA, you must be:
  • A resident of the state of Texas or organization established in the state of Texas, AND
  • An individual artist with a combined annual household income less than $50,000 OR an arts nonprofit organization with annual gross revenue less than $200,000 AND less than $500,000 in assets.

If you meet the qualifications above, you are eligible to be matched with a volunteer.

First, become a member of TALA.   Then, fill out a Request for Assistance Form:
  • All Individual Artist Members please use the Individual Request for Assistance.
  • All NonProfit Organizations please use the Organization Request for Assistance.
  All individuals and organizations requesting assistance must be current members of TALA. Renew or join TALA as a member.

item.title: Donate
item.dc:creator: bobbyjoseph
item.content:encoded:
TALA's services are made possible through generous donations. Your contribution will directly impact Texas artists.
Contribution Levels
Level Amount Impact
ANGEL $5,000 allows TALA to engage a contractor in another city for a year, exponentially increasing programming and outreach
BENEFACTOR $2,500 underwrites a clinic staffed by volunteer professionals, typically serving 15-25 artists
PATRON $1,000 sponsors an educational seminar on a specific accounting or legal topic
SPONSOR $500 creates an arts related 501c3 corporation, including TALA staff time filing forms with the state and drafting bylaws, activities statements, conflict of interest policies, and three-year budgets. A volunteer lawyer completes the final paperwork
FRIEND $100 pays to match one artist in need with a volunteer lawyer or accountant
[seamless-donations]

item.title: Becoming A Volunteer
item.dc:creator: herinnisha
item.content:encoded:
Test

  • Toggle High Contrast
  • Toggle Grayscale
  • Toggle Font size

What is TALA?

Texas Accountants and Lawyers for the Arts is a 501 (c)(3) nonprofit organization that provides pro bono legal and accounting services to individual artists and nonprofit organizations statewide. TALA has been serving Texas artists since 1979. TALA handles some cases in-house, but the majority of cases are handled by TALA Volunteer Attorneys and Accountants from across the state.

Who does TALA serve?

TALA assists individual artists who are members of TALA and whose annual household income is $50,000 or less. Our clients come from many artistic disciplines including the visual arts, writing, acting, dancing, singing, musical performance, and performance art. Nonprofit clients include museums, theater companies, arts groups, dance troupes, libraries and writers guilds. Nonprofits must have annual revenues less than $200,000 and total assets less than $500,000 to qualify.

How does TALA membership work?

In order to receive TALA services, artists and nonprofits must become members. Individual memberships for artists are $50, bands are $100, and nonprofit organizations are $200. The membership fee helps defray administrative costs. With a one year membership, members receive unlimited (within the available scope of the services we provide) pro bono legal and accounting services, a subscription to the TALA newsletter and Art Law and Accounting Reporter, and invitations to TALA events.

Who can become a volunteer?

To handle TALA cases, volunteer attorneys must be licensed in the state of Texas and be in good standing with the Bar. An accounting volunteer must be a licensed CPA. Anyone can volunteer for special events and assist in the TALA office. Due to legal relationships between TALA and its clients, TALA does not use legal or accounting volunteers for administrative tasks within the office.

What types of legal cases does TALA handle?

All legal cases TALA handles must be art related. For artists, that includes copyright, gallery agreements, contracts, trademark, civil rights, entertainment issues, general business advice, bankruptcy, wills, forming a corporation, insurance, and landlord/tenant studio disputes. For nonprofits TALA handles cases dealing with resolving board disputes, board liability, dissolving nonprofit organizations, employment, creating nonprofit organizations, and tax issues. TALA can also handle some mediation cases for artists and nonprofits.

What types of accounting cases does TALA handle?

Accounting volunteers provide TALA clients with a wide variety of services. For the arts organizations, setting up their bookkeeping, payroll, and accounting related questions are the most common cases. For individual artists, accountants can assist with bookkeeping and setting up record keeping systems.

What is the volunteer process?

Every 2 to 3 weeks, an email is sent to all TALA volunteers listing the available cases. Once you run a conflicts check, volunteers should email TALA informing us of which cases you are interested in taking. A letter is then sent to both the client and the volunteer that confirms the case has been taken and also informs both parties of how to contact each other. It is the clients responsibility to make initial contact with the volunteer, but the volunteer may make the initial contact if they choose to do so.

What is the time commitment?

The time commitment varies for each case, but generally, TALA cases are fairly brief in nature. TALA does not provide ongoing representation with the same attorney or accoutant, so once you complete the matter, you are released. Although preparation of Form 990 is not time intensive, it can lend itself to an annual assignment.

Cases not handled by TALA:

    • Family Law
    • Criminal Law
    • Personal Injury
    • Litigation*
    • Audits
    * TALA does consult on small claims issues

    How is the case closed?

    When representation is complete, please fill out a Volunteer Evaluation Form and return it to TALA. This allows TALA to keep accurate records and lets us know what we can do to better serve you as a volunteer.

    If you are interested in becoming a TALA volunteer:

    • Contact Legal Director Angela L. Lee at 800.526.8252 or attorney@talarts.org OR
    • Fill out the online Volunteer Interest Questionnaire

";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298b14289d9";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:8;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:9;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:369:"

If you are interested in becoming a TALA volunteer:

  • Contact Legal Director Angela L. Lee at 800.526.8252or attorney@talarts.org OR
  • Fill out the online Volunteer Interest Questionnaire
";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298b2f2b3ca";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:9;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}}s:5:"grids";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"cells";i:1;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}s:10:"grid_cells";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:4:"grid";i:0;s:6:"weight";i:1;}}}

a:3:{s:7:"widgets";a:10:{i:0;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:411:"

What is TALA?

Texas Accountants and Lawyers for the Arts is a 501 (c)(3) nonprofit organization that provides pro bono legal and accounting services to individual artists and nonprofit organizations statewide. TALA has been serving Texas artists since 1979. TALA handles some cases in-house, but the majority of cases are handled by TALA Volunteer Attorneys and Accountants from across the state.

";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298a17d64c3";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:0;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:1;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:516:"

Who does TALA serve?

TALA assists individual artists who are members of TALA and whose annual household income is $50,000 or less. Our clients come from many artistic disciplines including the visual arts, writing, acting, dancing, singing, musical performance, and performance art. Nonprofit clients include museums, theater companies, arts groups, dance troupes, libraries and writers guilds. Nonprofits must have annual revenues less than $200,000 and total assets less than $500,000 to qualify.

";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298a607611c";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:1;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:2;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:533:"

How does TALA membership work?

In order to receive TALA services, artists and nonprofits must become members. Individual memberships for artists are $50, bands are $100, and nonprofit organizations are $200. The membership fee helps defray administrative costs. With a one year membership, members receive unlimited (within the available scope of the services we provide) pro bono legal and accounting services, a subscription to the TALA newsletter and Art Law and Accounting Reporter, and invitations to TALA events.

";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298a8ed1fe3";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:2;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:3;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:430:"

Who can become a volunteer?

To handle TALA cases, volunteer attorneys must be licensed in the state of Texas and be in good standing with the Bar. An accounting volunteer must be a licensed CPA. Anyone can volunteer for special events and assist in the TALA office. Due to legal relationships between TALA and its clients, TALA does not use legal or accounting volunteers for administrative tasks within the office.

";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298aa1acd75";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:3;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:4;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:597:"

What types of legal cases does TALA handle?

All legal cases TALA handles must be art related. For artists, that includes copyright, gallery agreements, contracts, trademark, civil rights, entertainment issues, general business advice, bankruptcy, wills, forming a corporation, insurance, and landlord/tenant studio disputes. For nonprofits TALA handles cases dealing with resolving board disputes, board liability, dissolving nonprofit organizations, employment, creating nonprofit organizations, and tax issues. TALA can also handle some mediation cases for artists and nonprofits.

";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298ab798c72";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:4;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:5;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:363:"

What types of accounting cases does TALA handle?

Accounting volunteers provide TALA clients with a wide variety of services. For the arts organizations, setting up their bookkeeping, payroll, and accounting related questions are the most common cases. For individual artists, accountants can assist with bookkeeping and setting up record keeping systems.";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298aca7fa5c";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:5;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:6;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:557:"

What is the volunteer process?

Every 2 to 3 weeks, an email is sent to all TALA volunteers listing the available cases. Once you run a conflicts check, volunteers should email TALA informing us of which cases you are interested in taking. A letter is then sent to both the client and the volunteer that confirms the case has been taken and also informs both parties of how to contact each other. It is the clients responsibility to make initial contact with the volunteer, but the volunteer may make the initial contact if they choose to do so. ";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298ae386e64";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:6;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:7;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:585:"

What is the time commitment?

The time commitment varies for each case, but generally, TALA cases are fairly brief in nature. TALA does not provide ongoing representation with the same attorney or accoutant, so once you complete the matter, you are released. Although preparation of Form 990 is not time intensive, it can lend itself to an annual assignment.

Cases not handled by TALA:

  • Family Law
  • Criminal Law
  • Personal Injury
  • Litigation*
  • Audits
* TALA does consult on small claims issues
";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298af5d0c2e";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:7;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:8;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:243:"

How is the case closed?

When representation is complete, please fill out a Volunteer Evaluation Form and return it to TALA. This allows TALA to keep accurate records and lets us know what we can do to better serve you as a volunteer. ";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298b14289d9";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:8;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}i:9;a:5:{s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:4:"text";s:369:"

If you are interested in becoming a TALA volunteer:

  • Contact Legal Director Angela L. Lee at 800.526.8252or attorney@talarts.org OR
  • Fill out the online Volunteer Interest Questionnaire
";s:5:"autop";b:1;s:12:"_sow_form_id";s:13:"56298b2f2b3ca";s:11:"panels_info";a:6:{s:5:"class";s:31:"SiteOrigin_Widget_Editor_Widget";s:3:"raw";b:0;s:4:"grid";i:0;s:4:"cell";i:0;s:2:"id";i:9;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}}s:5:"grids";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"cells";i:1;s:5:"style";a:1:{s:18:"background_display";s:4:"tile";}}}s:10:"grid_cells";a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:4:"grid";i:0;s:6:"weight";i:1;}}}

item.title: FAQs
item.dc:creator: alimustan
item.content:encoded:
How can I get assistance from TALA ?

In order to receive assistance from TALA you must be a member. Once you are a member, we will look at the circumstances of your case and determine whether it can be handled by one of TALA's staff attorneys or pro bono volunteers. If we cannot assist you, we will do our best to refer you to an attorney who may be able to help.

Are there any reasons TALA may not be able to assist me?

While TALA does its best to help as many clients as possible, TALA reserves the right to reject a client's application for assistance under certain circumstances, including, but not limited to:Matters requiring litigation. TALA does not handle litigation. TALA does, however, provide mediation services, which is a possible alternative to litigation.Complex matters potentially requiring too much time to be resolved on a volunteer basis.Unavailability of a qualified volunteer to handle a particular request.You may not meet our income guidelines. While TALA does its best to help as many clients as possible, TALA reserves the right to reject a client's application for assistance under certain circumstances, including, but not limited to:
  • Matters requiring litigation. TALA does not handle litigation. TALA does, however, provide mediation services, which is a possible alternative to litigation.
  • Complex matters potentially requiring too much time to be resolved on a volunteer basis.
  • Unavailability of a qualified volunteer to handle a particular request.
  • You may not meet our income guidelines.
Please also note that TALA cannot accept cases that require immediate assistance. If you need immediate assistance, we'll do our best to find you an appropriate referral agency.

What kind of cases does TALA handle?

  • TALA assists with legal issues pertaining to individual artists: contracts, copyright, licensing agreements, art-related insurance, landlord/tenant issues (pertaining to studio space).
  • TALA does not assist business entities such as record labels or production companies.
  • TALA also assists with legal issues for arts nonprofits: board issues, contracts, leasing agreements, etc.
  • TALA does not handle: tax returns, family law, criminal law, business associations, bankruptcy, or litigation.

Where can I look for help if my issue is not something handled by TALA?

  • For general legal assistance throughout Texas: www.texaslawhelp.org
  • For nonprofit organizations in Texas: http://www.tano.org/
  • For a referral for an attorney for hire, contact the State Bar of Texas Lawyer Referral Service, or for Austin and Central Texas, contact the Lawyer Referral Service of Central Texas.
  • For a referral for a CPA for hire, contact the Texas Society for CPAs.
  • If you arent sure if TALA handles your type of case, just drop us a line at Well do our best to help!

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: talartswp
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.
